Yixiong ChangLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 13 Nov 2018Before u put money anywhere, you should probably try to learn more first. Start attending courses by those big names institutions. Most are free or just a nominal fee. For eg. SGX academyhttps://www.sgxacademy.com/Securities investors association also have a series of programmes for investors learning. https://sias.org.sg/events/events-calendar/I would suggest that u should evaluate what are your financial goals. What do u want to achieve. Thereafter, u can then learn what is necessary. Investing (in general) is a very broad topic, learning somethings will not come cheap (either direct cost in learning fees or indirect cost such as losing money in investment). Knowing what u want to achieve at the end can reduce many unnecessary steps.Another way is to find a trusted financial advisor rep who is willingly and have the knowledge to provide u with the info u need (without any sales bias).
